frames.processing

Class Java2DMatrixHandler

  • java.lang.Object
    • frames.core.MatrixHandler
      • frames.processing.Java2DMatrixHandler

  • public class Java2DMatrixHandler
extends MatrixHandler
    Internal MatrixHandler based on PGraphicsJava2D graphics transformations.

      • applyModelView

        Description copied from class: MatrixHandler

        Overrides:
        applyModelView in class MatrixHandler

      • beginHUD

        public void beginHUD()
        Description copied from class: MatrixHandler
        Begin Heads Up Display (HUD) so that drawing can be done using 2D screen coordinates.

        All screen drawing should be enclosed between MatrixHandler.beginHUD() and MatrixHandler.endHUD(). Then you can just begin drawing your screen shapes. Attention: If you want your screen drawing to appear on top of your 3d graph then draw first all your 3d before doing any call to a MatrixHandler.beginHUD() and MatrixHandler.endHUD() pair.

        Overrides:
        beginHUD in class MatrixHandler
        See Also:
        MatrixHandler.endHUD()

      • endHUD

        public void endHUD()
        Description copied from class: MatrixHandler
        Ends Heads Up Display (HUD). See MatrixHandler.beginHUD() for details.
        Overrides:
        endHUD in class MatrixHandler
        See Also:
        MatrixHandler.beginHUD()

      • scale

        public void scale(float sx,
                  float sy)
        Description copied from class: MatrixHandler
        Scale in X and Y. Equivalent to scale(sx, sy, 1).

        Not recommended for use in 3D, because the z-dimension is just scaled by 1, since there's no way to know what else to scale it by.

        Overrides:
        scale in class MatrixHandler
